subject: Fashion
title: Blue as the Trust Color
description: One-minute skill: Blue as the Trust Color.

hook.text: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, IBMâ€”the world's biggest platforms chose blue. That's no coincidence.

buildup.text: Blue is the world's most popular color across cultures. It consistently evokes calm, trust, and reliability.

discovery.text: Police uniforms shifted to blue because studies showed it reduced public aggression compared to darker tones.

twist.text: But blue rarely appears in food branding. Our brains link blue to poisonâ€”very few natural foods are blue.

climax.text: Blue builds trust in clothing, logos, and uniforms. But context flips its meaning entirely.

punchline.text: Trust wears blue. Just don't put it on a dinner plate.

quiz.question: Why is blue rarely used in food packaging and branding?
options: Blue dye is too expensive for mass-market food packaging
Blue is associated with cold temperatures which suggests staleness
The brain associates blue with poison because very few natural foods are blue
